The kiln keeper replied.
"They'll be compatible.
The Buddha sat calmly in one place.
He then thought to himself, "Suppose he says.
'Is this Pukkusāti?'
He got up and went to Phokkasar.
He asked him.
"Which path did your teacher accept as an ascetic?
He replied.
'I've heard there's a Buddha who's now my teacher.'
The Buddha thought.

source_sentence: 是賢者為用我故作沙門。
translation: 'That good man made himself an ascetic for my use.
I will explain the sūtras that were known at the time of your previous life.
Then he'll understand it.
The Buddha said.
"I'll explain the sūtras for you.
Listen well!
Pukkusha said, "Good!
The Buddha taught the Dharma for him.
He's attained the third level of the path of non-returners.
He can tell that he's the Buddha's ear.
He then got up and paid homage to the Buddha.
On the morrow, he hadn't gone far into the city.
A little-toothed cow touched Pūrvajāta.
The monks said to the Buddha.
"Yesterday, the Buddha was teaching a sūtra at a kiln.
That ascetic was killed by a bull.
What path will he follow?
The Buddha said.
'I taught you the sūtras and then I became an arhat.
I'll be born in the 16 heavens and become an arhat.'

source_sentence: 令諸比丘共取弗迦沙身。
translation: He told the monks to take Phokṣa's body together.
He had it well-picked up and buried.

source_sentence: 於其上起塔(出洴沙王五願經又出弗迦沙王因緣經)。
translation: They raised a stūpa on top of it (from the Sutra on the Five Vows of King Bimbisāra and also from the Sutra on the Causes and Conditions of King Phokṣaśas).

source_sentence: 赤馬天子問佛無生死處十二
translation: The Red Horse Prince of Heaven asked the Buddha about the twelve places where there's no birth and death.
There was then a red-horse prince.
His appearance was absolutely marvelous.
At the end of the night, he came to the Buddha.
He said to the Buddha.
"Bhagavān!
"Could it be that there's someone who can travel beyond the limits of the world.
Will he reach the place of no birth, no aging, and no death?'
The Buddha told Red Horse.
"There's no one who can reach it.
The red-horse prince also said to the Buddha.
"How wonderful, Bhagavān!
You've explained this meaning well.
It's just as the Bhagavān said.
Why is that?
He recalls his past life.
He was named Red Horse.
He became a sage of a non-Buddhist religion.
He attained supernormal powers and became free of cravings.
I then thought.
'I have the spiritual powers to be so swift.'
I'm like a strong man who shoots a sharp arrow across the face.
I'll pass through the shadow of a palm tree.
I'll be able to ascend to Sumeru.
I'll reach one Sumeru.
He steps on the eastern ocean and transcends to the western ocean.

source_sentence: 我念神力捷疾今求世界邊。
translation: I think of the quickness of my spiritual powers as I now seek the limit of the world.
I then aroused my feet and departed.
The only thing I've done is to eat, rest, and practice.
I'll always travel a hundred years with less restraint and sleep.
At the end of my life on the path, I won't be able to reach it.

source_sentence: 即沒不現(出雜阿含第二十九卷)。
translation: He then disappears and doesn't show up (out of Book 29 of the Mahāyāna).
The Wise King of Many Pretended to Be Crazy to Avoid Disaster 13
"There's bad rain in a foreign country.
If it falls into a river, lake, well, or pond.
People eat it, and they get wildly drunk for seven days.
There's a king of a country.

source_sentence: 多智善知惡雨見雲以知。
translation: He's wise and well informed about bad rain. He knows it when he sees a cloud.
He made him cover a well so that the rain wouldn't fall in.
Then, a hundred officials and ministers ate the bad rainwater.
They all went crazy in court.

source_sentence: 脫衣赤裸泥土塗頭坐王殿上。
translation: They stripped naked, smeared their heads with dirt, and sat in the king's hall.
The king was the only one who wasn't crazy.
All the ministers didn't know they were crazy.
Instead, they said the king was crazy.
"Why is he dressed differently than the others?
They all said to each other.
"This is not a trivial matter, so let's consider making it appropriate.

source_sentence: 王恐諸臣欲反便自怖懅。
translation: The king was afraid that the ministers might want to turn against him, so he became frightened.
He said to the ministers.
"I have a good medicine that can heal my own illness.
Let's stop here and wait for me to take the medicine.

source_sentence: 王便入內脫衣同其而出。
translation: The king then went inside, took off his robes, and left with them.
All the ministers rejoiced when they saw this.

source_sentence: 七日之後群臣醒悟大自慚愧。
translation: After seven days, the ministers awoke and were greatly ashamed.
They each put on their robes and robes and came to the court.
The king then sat naked as before.
The ministers were all surprised and asked.
"The king always has a lot of wisdom.
Why is it that he's like this?
The king answered the ministers.
"My mind is always fixed, and there's no change.
You're crazy to say that I'm crazy because you're crazy.

source_sentence: 非實心也(出雜譬喻經第四卷)。
translation: It's not the real mind (from the fourth volume of the Zaomiyao jing).
Sutra and Vinaya: Different Aspects, Volume 28
